text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Atomiswave is a cartridge-based arcade system utilizing JAMMA peripherals, created by Japanese company Sammy in 2003 based on the Dreamcast's hardware. It was a cost-effective, modular system, facilitating for multiple input methods. It is equipped with a Hitachi SH-4 CPU at 200MHz, 16MB of RAM and a PowerVR 2 GPU. With the retirement of the Neo Geo MVS, SNK chose to use the Atomiswave as its next system for future games, but the majority of titles for the system were developed by Sammy itself. Sammy would merge with Sega in 2004.
